dataGroup.data: The 4K Hybrid Digital Single Lens Mirrorless Camera Featuring High Photographic Performance and Mobility
Capture the Perfect Moment — 4K Video and 4K Photo
Enhanced 4K Photo Modes; 4K Burst, 4K Burst S/S and 4K Pre-burst
Focus on the Moment — Contrast AF with DFD Technology and AF Tracking
Everything in the Right Place — Sophisticated Body Design
High Image Quality Even in Low Light Conditions
Capture the Perfect Moment — 4K Video and 4K Photo

With the introduction of the LUMIX G7, you will be able to record video in 4K (up to QFHD: 3840x2160 pixels, 25 fps,100Mbit/s). Furthermore, three 4K Photo functions are integrated to capture the fleeting photo opportunities; 4K Burst, 4K Burst S/S (Start/Stop) and 4K Pre-burst. All these functions allow you to capture that perfect moment at a high burst rate of 30 fps, and save it as an 8-megapixel photos. The hybrid LUMIX G7 frees your creativity for both video and photo. ・ When recording videos in 4K, use a card rated as UHS Speed Class 3.
Focus on the Moment — Contrast AF with DFD Technology and Fast, Precise AF Tracking

Be ready to grab the next sudden shutter opportunity. Adding Depth From Defocus (DFD) technology* to Contrast AF has achieved both higher precision and greater speed at approximately 0,07 seconds**. This combines with approximately 200% AF Tracking performance***, 8 fps (AFS) / 6 fps (AFC) burst shooting, and UHS-II SDXC Memory Card compatibility to turn those once-in-a-lifetime moments into memories that last forever. * Works only with Panasonic Micro Four Thirds lenses. ** In AFS, with the H-FS14140. *** Panasonic comparison with LUMIX G6.
Everything in the Right Place — Sophisticated Body Design and Intuitive Operation

LUMIX G7 features a sophisticated body design with a hand-fitting grip and an intuitive level of operation. The 2,360k-dot OLED LVF helps you to frame your images even under bright sunlight conditions, and the body design allows you to freely customize settings. The front/rear dials control the main aperture and shutter speed settings, while easily switching to handle temporary WB and ISO adjustments. Settings can also be assigned to function buttons. The 4K Photo mode can quickly be active by using the 4K Photo feature on the drive mode dial.
High Image Quality Even in Low Light Conditions

The 16-megapixel Digital Live MOS Sensor in combination with the Venus Engine provides both: high quality image capture and high speed signal processing. The superior noise reduction system enables crisp images even in low light conditions up to ISO 25,600. The Venus Engine also excels in diffraction compensation to make images crisp and clear even when shooting with a small aperture. In addition, LUMIX G7 is capable of focusing in low light conditions down to -4EV. That is the equivalent of a starry night without any other light source.

The connectivity features of LUMIX G7 expand the usability of your camera in many ways. The camera can be controlled by using the 'Panasonic Image App' on your smartphone or tablet device enabling you to view the image, set the focus, release the shutter from a distance or review photographs on the large screen of your tablet. Or even share your images on social media. By using the GPS log/tag of your smartphone or tablet, you will be able to have the information where the picture was taken automatically attached to the image.
LUMIX Digital Single Lens Mirrorless Camera DMC-G7
DSLM (Digital Single Lens Mirrorless) Camera featuring 4K Video Recording, and Enhanced 4K Photo Modes for Spur-of-the-Moment Shots. 14-140mm Lens Kit
Save those precious times in breathtaking beauty with 4K video. And capture special moments with 4K Photo. This hybrid 4K camera will keep them splendid forever.
4K Video and 4K Photo — Capture the Perfect Moment
4K Video — More Details Than Full HD
High Speed Auto-Focusing with DFD Technology
Focusing in Low Light Conditions — Star Light AF

"* About motion picture recording / 4K Photo recording
- Use a card with SD Speed Class with ""Class 4"" or higher when recording motion pictures.
- Use a card with SD Speed Class with ""UHS-I / UHS-II UHS Speed Class 3 (U3)"" when recording motion pictures with [MP4] in [4K] or [4K PHOTO].
(SD speed class is the speed standard regarding continuous writing.)
- Maximum time to record motion pictures continuously with [MP4] in [4K] is 29 minutes 59 seconds.

- You can continuously record a motion picture with its size set to [4K] in [MP4] or [4K PHOTO] without a pause even if the motion picture exceeds 4GB. However, the recorded content has to be played back as multiple files.
- Maximum time to record motion pictures continuously with [MP4] in [FHD] [HD] [VGA] is 29 minutes 59 seconds or up to 4 GB.
- Maximum time to record motion pictures continuously with [AVCHD] is 29 minutes 59 seconds in Europe.
** For [4K] video output, use an HDMI cable that has the HDMI logo on it, and that is described as"4K compatible".
